title: City Registration
description:
📝 Everyone in Germany must register their address within 2 weeks of moving in. This is required by law and you'll need the registration document for:

• Opening a bank account
• Getting a residence permit
• Starting a job

Book an appointment:
https://www.wuerzburg.de/rathaus/buergerbuero/terminvereinbarung.

Bring your passport and rental contract! 🏠

title: Residence Permit Application
description:
📋 Required documents for residence permit:

• Completed application form:
https://www.wuerzburg.de/r_409094
• Current enrollment certificate
• Current ECTS overview
• Health insurance proof
• Blocked account with minimum €5,952 (better €11,904 for longer permit)
• Biometric photo (€7, take at service point)
• Valid passport
• Application Fee: €100

💰 Important financial notes:
• Monthly allowance: €992 (from Oct 2024)
• Work contracts not accepted as financial proof
• Alternative: Formal obligation (§68 AufenthG) or scholarship

⏰ Important:
• Contact immigration office 2 months before visa expires
• Email depends on first letter of your last name.

Find your contact here:
https://www.wuerzburg.de/rathaus/internationale-angelegenheiten/staatsangehoerigkeits--und-auslaenderangelegenheiten/studium

⚠️ Requirements may change! Always check with the immigration office for current requirements.

title: Visiting a Doctor
description:
👨‍⚕️ In Germany, you should register with a family doctor (Hausarzt) as they:

• Are your first point of contact when sick
• Can refer you to specialists
• Know your medical history
• Handle regular check-ups

Find family doctors in Würzburg here:
https://www.medpertise.de/aerzte/allgemeinarzt-hausarzt/wuerzburg/

For emergencies, call 112 for an ambulance. 🚑

title: Medical On-Call Service
description:
📞 When you need medical help outside regular office hours but it's not life-threatening:

• Call 116 117 (no area code needed)
• Free medical advice 24/7
• They can send an on-call doctor

For real emergencies, still call 112! 🚨

description: 🚌 Your semester ticket (included in semester fees) gives you free rides within Würzburg. Check the WVV app for schedules and routes!

title: Deutschland Ticket
description:
🎫 Regular price: 58€ monthly, but students get a discount through the WVV app:

• App Store:
https://apps.apple.com/de/app/wvvmobil/id6462117058
• Google Play:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mdv.wvvgullivr&hl=de

✈️ Travel anywhere in Germany with public transport! Plus, you can also travel to select cities in:

• Austria (Salzburg)
• Denmark (Tønder)
• France (Strasbourg)
• Luxembourg (Luxembourg)

⚠️ Important notes:

• Valid only for 2nd class regular trains
• Automatically renews each month
• Cancel before the 10th to avoid next month's charge
• Buying after the 10th commits you to 2 months

title: Radio and TV Tax (Rundfunkbeitrag)
description:
📺 The Rundfunkbeitrag is mandatory in Germany:

• Cost: €18.36 monthly
• One payment per apartment (not per person)
• Register at: www.rundfunkbeitrag.de

💡 Tips:
• Share the cost with roommates
• Payment options: quarterly, or yearly
• Keep proof of payment

⚠️ Don't ignore letters from ARD ZDF Deutschlandradio - fines can be expensive!

title: Important Daily Life Info
description:
⚠️ Essential things to know in Germany:

🏪 Shopping Hours:
• Most stores close at 20:00 (8 PM)
• Closed on Sundays and public holidays
• Plan grocery shopping accordingly
• Some gas stations and small shops at train stations remain open
• Bring your own shopping bags or you'll need to buy them

🌐 Internet Usage:
• Never use torrent services
• Fines for illegal downloads can be thousands of euros
• Use official streaming services only

🚂 Public Transport:
• Trains can face delays
• Download Deutsche Bahn app for real-time updates
• Always plan extra time for important appointments
• Sign up for delay alerts

📅 Public Holidays:
• Check local holiday calendar
• Stores and offices are closed
• Public transport runs on holiday schedule

🏛️ Studentenwerk:
• Mensa: a net of cantines with very reasonable prices for students
• Application for dorms
• Cultural events
• Infopoint and help for newcomers

https://www.swerk-wue.de/en/wuerzburg

title: New Student Checklist
description:
✅ Essential steps when arriving in Germany as a student:

0️⃣ Before Arrival:
• Make sure you have all the documents for enrollment and arrival
• Find an insurance company and sign a contract with them
• If you want to live in a student dorm, apply as soon as possible
• Be aware of fraud when applying for WGs and private apartments

1️⃣ First Week:
• Register your address (Anmeldung) within 2 weeks
• Contact your health insurance company to confirm arrival and complete activation
• Open a German bank account
• Get a SIM card for your phone

2️⃣ First Month:
• Apply for residence permit (if non-EU and visa expires in 3 months)
• Get student ID
• Register for Germany TV tax (Rundfunkbeitrag)

3️⃣ Getting Started:
• Find accommodation
• Register with a family doctor (Hausarzt)
• Consider Deutschland Ticket for nationwide travel

4️⃣ Integration:
• Join orientation events at university
• Register for German language courses
• Get to know the city transport system
• Join university sports or clubs

💡 Pro Tips:
• Keep copies of all important documents
• Save emergency numbers (112 for emergencies, 116117 for medical)
• Learn about waste separation rules
• Download essential apps (public transport, banking)
• Join student groups on social media

⚠️ Remember:
• Always carry student card (it's your transportation ticket)
• Keep residence permit appointments
• Check email regularly for university communications
• Plan finances carefully

More detailed information available in other sections!
